intro: Diospyros crassipes, commonly known as the African date palm, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad, umbrella-like crown. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits that are similar in appearance to dates. The leaves are large, palmate, and have a waxy surface, while the bark is smooth and grayish in color. This plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments.
